degree_program.name: Associate of Applied Science (AAS) in Taxation & Accounting

courses.title: College Composition I
learning_outcomes: Write clear, well-organized business correspondence
Apply professional writing standards
Develop persuasive communication skills

courses.title: Business Mathematics & Quantitative Reasoning
learning_outcomes: Solve business math problems involving percentages, ratios, and statistics
Apply quantitative analysis to real-world scenarios
Interpret financial data and graphs

courses.title: Introduction to Business
learning_outcomes: Understand business fundamentals and structures
Explain market economics and business models
Apply ethical decision-making frameworks

courses.title: Professional Communication
learning_outcomes: Deliver clear verbal and written communication
Present professionally in business contexts
Listen and respond professionally to feedback

courses.title: Professional Ethics
learning_outcomes: Analyze ethical dilemmas in business and professional practice
Understand codes of professional conduct
Apply ethical frameworks to decision-making

courses.title: Financial Accounting I
learning_outcomes: Understand accounting principles and journal entries
Create balance sheets and income statements
Apply GAAP standards

courses.title: Financial Accounting II
learning_outcomes: Account for receivables, inventory, and assets
Prepare consolidated financial statements
Analyze financial ratios and trends

courses.title: Payroll & Withholding Compliance
learning_outcomes: Calculate payroll taxes and withholdings
Prepare payroll reports (941, W-2, W-3)
Ensure compliance with federal and state requirements

courses.title: Individual Income Tax I (Form 1040 Foundations)
learning_outcomes: Identify income types and filing requirements
Complete Form 1040 and basic schedules
Apply standard and itemized deductions

courses.title: Individual Income Tax II (Schedules & Advanced Topics)
learning_outcomes: Prepare complex tax returns with capital gains, investment income
Complete Schedules C, D, E, and other attachments
Apply tax credits and alternative minimum tax concepts

courses.title: Business Tax (Sole Prop, Partnership, S-Corp Overview)
learning_outcomes: Calculate taxable income for different business entities
Prepare Form 1040 Schedule C (sole prop), Form 1065 (partnership)
Understand S-corp and C-corp tax treatment

courses.title: Tax Law & Research
learning_outcomes: Research tax issues using IRS publications and court decisions
Analyze tax authority and precedent
Write professional tax research memos

courses.title: Tax Preparation Technology & Practice Management
learning_outcomes: Use professional tax software (ProSeries, TaxAct, etc.)
Manage client files and workflows
Generate reports and maintain audit trails

courses.title: IRS Representation Basics & Client Communication
learning_outcomes: Understand taxpayer rights and representation rules
Communicate with IRS agents professionally
Represent clients in correspondence and meetings (within scope)

courses.title: Ethics & Circular 230 Overview
learning_outcomes: Understand Circular 230 standards for tax practitioners
Apply ethics rules in client relationships
Recognize conflicts of interest and confidentiality requirements

courses.title: Tax Practice Capstone Simulation
learning_outcomes: Integrate knowledge across all tax and accounting courses
Prepare comprehensive tax returns for realistic client scenarios
Demonstrate professional competency and ethical judgment

courses.title: Client Experience & Onboarding
learning_outcomes: Design client intake processes
Manage client relationships and expectations
Build client trust and professional reputation

courses.title: Small Business Bookkeeping & QuickBooks
learning_outcomes: Set up and manage small business accounting systems
Use QuickBooks for bookkeeping and reporting
Reconcile accounts and generate financial statements

courses.title: Fraud Prevention & Data Security Basics
learning_outcomes: Identify common fraud schemes in tax and accounting
Implement data security best practices
Protect client and institutional information

courses.title: Career Readiness & Professional Development
learning_outcomes: Build professional networks and credentials
Develop job search and interview skills
Plan continuing education and career advancement

degree_program.credit_hour_definition: A semester credit hour is a reasonable approximation of the minimum amount of student work required to achieve intended learning outcomes, verified through evidence of student achievement, and consistent with commonly accepted higher education practice. Each course syllabus includes: outcomes, learning activities, assessments, and the expected student work supporting the assigned credits.

clock_hour_crosswalk.metric: For planning and reporting purposes, the institution equates one 10-week term to 75 clock hours of guided instructional activity (7.5 clock hours/week). Credit hours remain the official academic measure for degree programs; clock hours are used as a secondary planning metric for online engagement and progress reporting.

satisfactory_academic_progress.pace: Complete at least 50% of program credits per term

completion_requirements: Achieve passing grade (C or higher) in all courses

disclosure_statements.not_accredited: This institution is authorized by the State of Texas and is not currently accredited by a regional or national accrediting body.
disclosure_statements.no_title_iv: This degree is not eligible for federal Title IV financial aid. Financial assistance may be available through employer reimbursement or partner institutions.
disclosure_statements.no_licensure_guarantee: Completion of this program does not guarantee passage of professional licensure exams or eligibility for specific professional credentials.
disclosure_statements.distance_education_rsi: Regular and substantive interaction is provided through instructor-led lessons, feedback, discussions, and assessments. Students will verify identity and participate in proctored assessments as required.
